summary: An email from the Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida, requesting access to boxes of documents from the prior Florida investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators, which are stored in West Palm Beach, for use in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual being prosecuted by the team in New York, which is the reason for the document request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The prior SDFL investigation was into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators; his records are the subject of the requested documents.

connections.description: The document references the prior investigation into Jeffrey Epstein 'and his co-conspirators,' and the current prosecution of Maxwell is related to that prior case.

events.title: Request for Epstein Investigation Documents
events.description: The Chief of the Public Corruption Unit (SDNY) emails the USAFLS office to request access to documents from the prior SDFL investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, stored in West Palm Beach, for the Maxwell prosecution.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York is prosecuting Ghislaine Maxwell.
Boxes of documents from the prior Southern District of Florida investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators are stored in the West Palm Beach office.
The SDNY prosecution team seeks to review and scan these Florida documents for use in their case against Maxwell.
The communication indicates ongoing inter-district coordination in the Epstein/Maxwell investigations.
